Description.Title: SiriusQuality Soil Temperature
Description.ExtendedDescription: SoilTemperature is a SiriusQuality component that computes soil temperature dynamics. It estimates daily minimum and maximum soil temperature from daily air temperatures (min, mean, max), soil heat flux, and a latent heat parameter (lambda_), while updating a deep soil layer temperature state with exponential smoothing initialized from the mean annual air temperature. Optionally, it derives hourly soil temperatures using the Parton & Logan (1981) diurnal model parameterized by a, b, and c and driven by day length. Inputs include meteorological variables and soil heat flux; outputs include daily min/max soil temperature, an hourly temperature profile, and an updated deep-layer temperature.
Description.ShortDescription: Component to compute daily min/max and hourly soil temperatures with deep-layer smoothing, including a Parton–Logan diurnal scheme.

Input.name: lambda_
Input.description: Latent heat of water vaporization at 20°C

Function.name: SoilMinimumTemperature
Function.description: Minimum soil temperature (°C) as the minimum of SoilTempA and SoilTempB.

Function.name: SoilMaximumTemperature
Function.description: Maximum soil temperature (°C) as the maximum of SoilTempA and SoilTempB.

Function.name: SoilTempA
Function.description: Soil temperature component A based on maximum air temperature, mean air temperature, and soil available energy.

Function.name: SoilTempB
Function.description: Soil temperature component B as the average of minimum air temperature and deep soil temperature.

Function.name: UpdateTemperature
Function.description: Update the deep soil temperature as a running mean with current mean soil temperature.
